User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hello, Nice to meet you
System: If you could eat only one food for the rest of time, what would it be?
User: Hmm... That's a tough one. I think I would go Asian Food > Chinese Food > Stirfry. What about you?
System: I think ice-cream. It may not be good for me, but I wouldn't care, haha
User: I love ice cream too!
System: Okay, top three flavors?
User: I like vanilla more than chocolate ice cream. I typically will do any variations on vanilla. To pick from the top of my head, I would say Cookies and Cream, Mint Chocolate Chip, and Coffee. How about you?
System: Ah, that's a good way of framing it. Me, I like berries: boysenberry one, strawberry two, maybe straight chocolate number 3 to mix it up a bit.
User: Very nice. I love sorbet's and smoothies. Changing topics, Do you believe in an afterlife?
System: Yes. I wonder if I'm in it right now. How would I know? What do you think?
User: I think so. I feel there must be something more than the physical world as we understand it.
System: There's a mental world, I suppose? Understanding itself
User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's it going?
User: Hi, how are you?
System: I'm doing well, thank you. How are you?
User: I'm fine. What's up?
System: Not much. How about you?
User: nothing new. Anything exciting happening recently?
System: Not really. You?
User: I watched a movie recently which was pretty good
System: That's good. What movie?
User: the irishman, have you seen it?
System: I have not. Should I?
User: I think so
System: Alright, I'll put it on my watch list.
User: How about you? Have you watched anything interesting recently?
System: I've been waiting to see the new Star Trek movie.
User: what is it about?
System: The adventures of Kirk, Spock, and McCoy.
User: when was it released?
System: It just came out today.
User: are you sure, I think it's been out for a while
System: I'm positive. I know because I just watched it.
User: well, the fact you just watched it doesn't mean it was released today
System: That's what I said, I did watch it today.
User: ok, I'll put it on my watchlist
System: Let me know what you think of it when you watch it.
User: sure, I need to go, nice talking to you

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey!
User: how's week so far?
System: pretty good, excited for thanksgiving you?
User: Same. Going to catch up on my reading! do you have a feast planned?
System: yup! gonna have dinner with family what books are you gonna read?
User: Something Deeply Hidden by Sean Carroll REDACTED_LINK
System: ahh nice what kind of books do you usually like to read
User: largely scifi How about you?
System: yeah I also like scifi and some non-fiction too have you read Seveneves by Neal Stephenson?
User: I haven't what is it about?
System: the moon is shattered by an asteroid and the pieces of the moon end up clouding the earth's atmostphere which causes almost every living creature on the planet to go extinct that's the premise of the book and the book is about the survivors
User: how do the survivors survive such a thing?
System: they go into space and they live there
User: sounds like a tv show I watched

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey, what's up?
User: Just chillin'. how are you?
System: I'm pretty good, thanks.
User: Do anything interesting today?
System: I went to the local cafe and had a double espresso. It was delicious. What about you?
User: Oh that's cool! I actually went to an amusement park and went on my first roller coaster!
System: Oh my gosh. What was it like??
User: It was scary! It was actually Kingda Ka, the world's tallest roller coaster. Ever heard of it?
System: No, never heard of it. But I'm not really a coaster aficianado. I've heard that some people get addicted to them and travel the world to try them.
User: Oh wow! I'm not on that level yet, but I understand the appeal. Are you an adrenaline junkie at all?
System: No, the opposite. I can't stand heights, horror movies, or confined spaces.
User: Same! I guess the roller coaster wasn't so bad because I trust the engineering haha
System: Ha, I suppose that makes sense! Would you say that you enjoyed it?
User: Maybe not so much at the time, but I am glad I did it now that it's done, know what I mean?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It's been great! Had some decaf coffee and a good lunch. How was yours?
System: Pretty good, thanks!
User: What'd you do today?
System: Stayed home and played video games.
User: Oh nice! What games?
System: Dying Light, Borderlands 2, and Bioshock Infinite.
User: Oh interesting. Which is your fav?
System: Dying Light, hands down.
User: Why?
System: It's just so fun.
User: Yeah but like what about it? Is it an FPS?
System: It's like Mirror's Edge, only in a zombie apocalypse.
User: Oh that's kinda cool!
System: It's hella fun.
User: Nice.
System: So, how have you been?
User: Fantastic

System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample9:

Conversation History:

System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i'm fine
System: Glad to hear it. What's new?
User: nothing much
System: Fair enough. What do you want to talk about?
User: do you have anything new?
System: Nope. Nothing that I can think of right now.

User: it's getting cold here too
System: Why don't you turn up the heat?
User: in the room yes

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it
